Legal_Issue: Whether the visa officer erred in rejecting the application without a personal interview or exercising discretion under s. 11(3) of the Regulations
Evidence_Assessment: Applicant failed to provide evidence of relevant training or experience as a Chef-Cook
Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to demonstrate qualifications for intended occupation
Legal_Rule: Visa officers are not obligated to conduct personal interviews or exercise discretion under s. 11(3) unless specific reasons are provided by the applicant
Procedural_Issue: Lack of personal interview and non-exercise of discretion under s. 11(3)
Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged procedural unfairness and failure to consider discretion
Outcome_on_Merits: Visa officer did not err; application properly assessed
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: No ambiguity warranted further inquiry; no request for s. 11(3) consideration
Key_Evidence_Considered: Applicant's lack of documented training or experience as Chef-Cook
Assessment under alternative occupation (Assistant Manager Restaurant)
Legal_Framework: Canadian immigration law and regulatory framework
Applicant_Challenge: Refusal of immigration application without interview or discretionary consideration
Legal_Rule_Source: s. 11(3) of the Canadian Immigration Regulations
Defendant_Response: Application properly evaluated based on submitted information
Remedy_Requested: Certification of questions and judicial intervention
Remedy_Sought: Overturning of visa refusal and direction to reassess with discretion or interview
